byline.contributor:
Reporting was contributed by Ford
Burkhart, Michelle A. Monroe and
Kellie Mejdrich from Tucson; Jess
Bidgood from Boston; Steven Yaccino
from Chicago; Ian Lovett from
Los Angeles; Isolde Raftery from
Seattle; Dan Frosch from Denver;
Robbie Brown from Atlanta; Ravi
Somaiya from London; and Cara
Buckley from New York.

abstract: Occupy protests across the country are marked by each city’s stew of circumstances and grievances, but the protesters seem united in feeling that the system is stacked against them; while there may be no common manifesto or list of goals--something that has drawn criticism from both inside and outside movement--common thread is anger.
